intro: Grewia kjellbergii, commonly known as the African star gooseberry, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, yellow-orange berries that are edible. The plant has simple, opposite leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in savanna habitats. The berries are a food source for various birds and small mammals.
